user_input: What is Carbonio and what does it provide at a high level?
reference: Carbonio is an on‑premises digital workplace platform providing enterprise email, contacts, calendars, real-time chat, video meetings and document editing, plus administration features like backup, archiving and legal hold for compliance and data sovereignty.

user_input: In Carbonio 25.12.0, can you upgrade directly from RHEL 8 to RHEL 9?
reference: No. In release 25.12.0 it is not possible to upgrade directly from RHEL 8 to RHEL 9.

user_input: What is the supported high-level procedure to upgrade Ubuntu 22.04 to 24.04 together with Carbonio?
reference: Upgrade Carbonio to the latest available version for your current OS release; Upgrade the operating system and update its repositories; Perform the OS upgrade (e.g., Ubuntu 22.04 to 24.04), then update all system packages to latest versions; Update the PostgreSQL and Carbonio repositories to match the new OS version; Upgrade the Carbonio packages again using the new repositories

user_input: How can an admin set a user's UI language from the CLI?
reference: Use the provisioning command as the zextras user, for example: carbonio prov ma alice@example.com zimbraPrefLocale <language_code>.

user_input: How can an admin set a Class of Service (COS) language from the CLI?
reference: Use the provisioning command as the zextras user, for example: carbonio prov mc <COS_name> zimbraPrefLocale <language_code>.

user_input: How can an admin check the current language preference for a user from the CLI?
reference: Run carbonio prov ga <user_email> zimbraPrefLocale as the zextras user.

user_input: Which Ansible Galaxy command installs the Carbonio upgrade collection?
reference: ansible-galaxy collection install zxbot.carbonio_upgrade

user_input: Which Ansible Galaxy command updates the carbonio_upgrade collection to the latest version?
reference: ansible-galaxy collection install -U zxbot.carbonio_upgrade

user_input: How do you check which version of the zxbot.carbonio_upgrade Ansible collection is installed?
reference: ansible-galaxy collection list zxbot.carbonio_upgrade

user_input: When upgrading with Ansible, which additional password files must be present alongside the inventory file?
reference: inventory_postgrespassword (DB_ADM password); inventory_ldap_password (ldap_password from zmlocalconfig); inventory_consulpassword (from /var/lib/service-discover/password); inventory_videoserver_password (VideoServer api_secret).

user_input: During the Carbonio 25.12.0 manual upgrade, what should you answer when prompted to replace localconfig.xml and why?
reference: Answer NO (default) to keep the existing localconfig.xml; replacing it can overwrite critical configuration parameters and cause the upgrade to fail and service disruption.

user_input: After upgrading packages, which command registers upgraded packages to Carbonio Mesh?
reference: pending-setups -a

user_input: After upgrading, how do you reinitialize the Message Dispatcher database and restart the service?
reference: Set DB_ADM_PWD to the PostgreSQL admin password, run PGPASSWORD=$DB_ADM_PWD carbonio-message-dispatcher-migration carbonio_adm 127.78.0.10 20000, then restart with systemctl restart carbonio-message-dispatcher.

user_input: When upgrading from older versions, what command bootstraps the new backup database on the Database Node?
reference: PGPASSWORD=$DB_ADM_PWD carbonio-mailbox-db-bootstrap carbonio_adm 127.0.0.1
